description: This salmon recipe is perfect for a midweek dinner. It's served with a delicious cranberry tabouli and takes just 25 minutes to make. Try it today.
name: Seared Salmon With Cranberry Tabouli & Tahini Dressing Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 640g Tasmanian Atlantic salmon fillets, skin on
1 bunch continental parsley, leaves picked, finely chopped
1 bunch mint, leaves picked, finely chopped
4 lemons, 3 juiced, 1 cut into wedges (wedges, to serve)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat half the oil in a large frying pan over mediumhigh heat. Cook salmon, skin-sides down, for 6 minutes. Turn over. Cook for 4 minutes or until salmon is just cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Rest, loosely covered with foil, for 2 minutes.

Meanwhile, place couscous in a large heatproof bowl. Add 3/4 cup boiling water. Cover and stand for 5 minutes. Stir with a fork to separate couscous grains. Add parsley, mint, cranberries, cucumber and half the lemon juice, then stir to combine. Season.
Place tahini, 2 tbs water, and remaining lemon juice and oil in a jug and stir to combine. Divide tabouli among plates. Top with salmon and drizzle with tahini dressing. Serve with lemon wedges.
